page.title: 01Lochnagar - The Summit Area
page.content: This area of Lochnagar massif is the most extensive area of upland, subalpine vegetation in the Eastern Cairngorms. Large snow wreaths remain well into the summer and these provide many interesting plant communities including alpine saxifrage and alpine speedwell. The cliffs in the area are a haven for many plant rarities including Blue Sow Thistle and Norwegian Cudweed. The area has two major land uses - recreation and game. Only deer and grouse shooting operate commercially but the cliffed coirie provides some of the finest winter mountaineering in the country. On many days, the area will appear bleak to the visitor, but in both summer and winter clear skies reveal a beauty which inspired Byron to write;
